required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Safety and Tolerability After Single Oral Dosing of AZD1656 in Japanese Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Single-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single-Centre, Phase I Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics After Single Ascending Oral Doses of AZD1656 in Japanese Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess safety and tolerability of AZD1656 after single ascending oral doses in Japanese healthy male subjects

primary_outcome.measure: Safety variables (AEs, blood pressure (BP), pulse, safety laboratory variables and electrocardiography (ECG)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Safety variables taken repeatedly during 24 hours on study day sessions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic variables taken repeatedly during 24 hours on study day sessions
Blood samples taken repeatedly during 24 hours on study day sessions

arm_group.description: AZD1656 in 6 increasing oral single doses given to 6 groups (5 on active and 1 on placebo in each group)

intervention.description: Dose escalation of oral single doses of AZD1656 to achieve maximal tolerated dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy Japanese males aged ≥20 and ≤40 years of age
- Clinically normal physical findings and laboratory values as judged by the investigator including negative test of Hepatitis B surface antigen, antibodies to HIV virus and antibodies to Hepatitis C virus
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant illness or clinically relevant trauma, as judged by the investigator, within two weeks before the first administration of the IP
- History of psychiatric or somatic disease/condition that may interfere with the objectives of the study, as judged by the investigator.

responsible_party.name_title: Klas Malmberg, MD, PhD, Prof. Medical Science Director, Emerging Products
